msContents.summary: A colloquial version of the Maturaivīraṉ Ammāṉai, preceded by two verse invocations borrowed, the first from the Vivēka Cintāmaṇi, the second from the Kāḷamēkap pulavar taṉippāṭals.

collation.desc: 1 folio = satellite stanzas: 2 verses of invocation. No foliation. Verso blank.
118 folios = main text: Maturaivīraṉ Ammāṉai, mūlam. Tamil foliation [1], 2-118 (first folio not explicitly foliated). f118v blank.
the back cover. With ex-libris and sticker.

supportDesc.condition: Good state of preservation. Some folios cracked.

layoutDesc.layout: Final letter(s) indented at the end of line.

additions.desc: Ex-libris on back cover: OB LENIT ET ARDET.
Sticker on back cover: 117 in black ink and Don de m. O. Beauregard in black pencil. Apparently sticker of the École des Langues orientales.

binding.p: Original bamboo covers, of irregular shape. 4-holed. The string is in leather. With a device made with a young hollow bamboo stick for fastening of the bundle (a needle-like device on each end of the string; a loop on one end of the string to thread the other end). As the string disintegrates the device is not used. With a stick to be threaded in one of the stringholes.

provenance.p: The manuscript has been part of the library of Olivier Beauregard. See his ex-libris glued on the back cover (s.n. 1904). On another such ex-libris on a manscript today kept at the BULAC (successor the bibliothèque de l'École des Langues Orientales), see Petit (2009, p. 199). Olivier Beauregard gave the manuscript to the École des Langues orientales. See sticker glued on the back cover.

acquisition.p: Deposited at the BnF in 1938, from the École des Langues Orientales.
